1. A simple closed curve made up of only line segments is called a polygon.
  2. A diagonal of a polygon is a line segment connecting two non consecutive vertices.
  3. A convex polygon is a polygon in which no portion of its any diagonal is in its exterior, otherwise it is a concave polygon.
  4. A quadrilateral is a polygon having only four sides.
  5. A regular polygon is a polygon whose all sides are equal and also all angles are equal.
  6. The sum of interior angles of a polygon of n sides is \((n-2) \times 180^o\).
  7. The sum of interior angles of a quadrilateral is \(360^o\).
  8. The sum of exterior angles, taken in an order, of a polygon is \(360^o\).
  9. Trapezium is a quadrilateral in which a pair of opposite sides is parallel.
  10. Kite is a quadrilateral which has two pairs of equal consecutive sides.
  11. A parallelogram is a quadrilateral in which each pair of opposite sides is parallel.
  12. A rhombus is a parallelogram in which adjacent sides are equal.
  13. A rectangle is a parallelogram in which one angle is of \(90^o\).
  14. A square is a parallelogram in which adjacent sides are equal and one angle is of \(90^o\).
  15. In a parallelogram, opposite sides are equal, opposite angles are equal and diagonals bisect each other.
  16. In a rhombus diagonals intersect at right angles.
  17. In a rectangle diagonals are equal.
